audio_sermons.title: (Spiritual Guidelines for Courtship) Godly Weddings
audio_sermons.description: What does a Godly wedding look like? Who should be involved in the process of planning a wedding? Brother Mose gives Biblical principles and practical advice to all who are involved in planning and preparing a God-honoring, Christ-centered wedding.

audio_sermons.title: (Spiritual Guidelines for Courtship) Practical Courtship Issues
audio_sermons.description: There are often many questions surrounding the courtship process. When is a young person ready to consider courtship? How should a young man begin? How should a courting couple relate to one another and to others? In this message, Brother Rick steps through the courtship process answering these and many similar questions along the way.

audio_sermons.title: (Spiritual Guidelines for Courtship) Preparing for Courtship
audio_sermons.description: How should youth prepare themselves for courtship? How can parents prepare their children for courtship? What are the differences between courtship, betrothal, and dating? Brother Rick draws on many principles from the Word of God and years of experience as a pastor and father to give sound answers to these questions and many others.

audio_sermons.title: (Spiritual Guidelines for Courtship) Questions and Answers on Courtship
audio_sermons.description: This message is a collection of several question and answer sessions in which Brother Rick attempted to answer many of the specific questions that we have concerning courtship.

audio_sermons.title: (Spiritual Guidelines for Courtship) Testimonies of Godly Courtship
audio_sermons.description: Does courtship really work? Are the blessings as great as the preachers make them sound? Listen as five couples give their testimonies of how the Lord brought them together, the beautiful ways that God worked in their lives to prepare them for courtship, the joy of honoring their authorities, the blessing of hands-off courtship, and much more.

audio_sermons.title: (Spiritual Guidelines for Courtship) The Courtship Relationship
audio_sermons.description: In this message Brother Rick gives several key building blocks that are important to the proper flow of a courtship. Courtship is essentially a relational process, and so it is vital that not only the relationship between the couple is properly developed and maintained, but also between them and their parents, their church, and God.

audio_sermons.title: A Heart for the Lost
audio_sermons.description: Rick Leibee examines the heart of Jesus and His mission to seek and save the lost through the eyes of the crowd, blind Bartimaeus, and Zaccheus.  The message is an exhortation to cast aside our natural inclination to be dispassionate towards lost souls, especially ones who are good at being sinners.  Do we have a heart that pities them? Do you have a heart for the lost? It is God’s heart that all should come to repentance. Do we move on with the good things of the Christian life and forget the lost? Consider the example of Jesus’ “detour” to Jericho for two sinners on His way to the cross. May God give us a bridge in our hearts for the lost.

audio_sermons.title: A Spiritual Voting Booth
audio_sermons.description: Should you as a Christian get out and vote? The question and the answer are much bigger than that. Jesus took no part in this world's kingdoms. How you handle this issue will affect many other areas of your life. May we be a royal priesthood set apart for the Kingdom of God.

audio_sermons.title: Able to Admonish
audio_sermons.description: A clear, point by point teaching on how to give and receive rebukes in the brotherhood. Not only is it a "must have" for personal growth, but it is a command that we must fulfill. We must also be easily entreated.

audio_sermons.title: An Anchor of the Soul
audio_sermons.description: Jesus Christ is our high priest Who is touched with our need. He wants to see us mature and grow, not stay on milk. If we are backsliding there is a sober warning for us. If we are running the race, no matter how hard it gets, we have a rock of refuge to which we can flee, an anchor for our soul.

audio_sermons.title: An Unchangeable Priesthood
audio_sermons.description: The law is only a shadow of things to come. We are powerless to save ouselves by the works of the law but Jesus Christ is the surety of our salvation. He is the high priest of a new and better covenant Who intercedes for us at the Father's right hand.

audio_sermons.title: Purity In Clothing
audio_sermons.description: Eight principles and many practical guidelines are given in raising the standard of godly attire. Various scriptures are given showing what God thinks and says about clothing for both men and women.

audio_sermons.title: The Best Last Word
audio_sermons.description: So many are searching for an answer to life's secrets. It isn't found in science. It is found in the person of Christ. He is Lord of all. He has finished the work and sat down—but he gives a warning. If an angel's word is sure, how much more Christ's? We will not escape if we neglect His salvation.

audio_sermons.title: The Father of Mercies
audio_sermons.description: An expository teaching on II Cor. 1. This chapter is full of many wonderful phrases. The most outstanding thing is what Rick says about sickness. The Father of mercies and the God of all comfort sometimes uses our sickness to comfort others. Afflictions also bring us to obey God’s word. Trust in God even in sicknesses.

audio_sermons.title: The Humanity of Christ
audio_sermons.description: Jesus Christ—fully God, fully man. He suffered and was tempted. Because of this, He is fully able to understand and help those who are tempted. Satan's power is broken in Christ. He is still powerful but we need not fear him. Christ has conquered and brought a better thing! Hold fast to Him and He will not let you go.

audio_sermons.title: The Road That Leads to Rest
audio_sermons.description: If you are wandering in a dry and barren wilderness in your Christian experience and struggling with assurance, the root problem is faith. You will not be able to move on in your Chritian life if you are not willing to yield everything to God and believe Him. If you are not entering into His rest, it is because of unbelief.
